keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring the social care system provides proper care and protection, especially for older people.
Ensure no one has to sell their home to pay for care, with an absolute limit on what people have to pay.
Protect life savings, including home, under the current system if in nursing home by capping the exposure of assets to pay for care.
Introduce new protections to allow anyone to take up to a year off work, without penalty, to care for a loved one.
Guarantee a double-lock for pensions, ensuring pensions will rise with inflation or average wages, whichever is higher.
Protect pensioner benefits, including free bus passes, eye tests, prescriptions, and TV licenses for over 75s.
Continue to provide the Winter Fuel Payment for the poorest pensioners who need it.

issues.brexitEurope: Best possible hand in the Brexit negotiations
issues.socialWelfare: social care system provides proper care and protection for those who need it, especially older people

housing.content: Ensure no one has to sell their home to pay for care. Under the current system if you are in a nursing home you could lose almost all your life savings - including your home.

images.caption: Campaign leaflet detailing Theresa May and the Conservative's plans for social care.
